result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No abusive contact with T.B.    Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.  Court stays signing of bond until 7 days of release from jail.

Case called:  2:49 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Rory McGarry.   Defendant appears in custody by video from Dane Co Jail.

**COURT quashes warrant**

COURT questions deft re: bond conditions. 
Defendant states he was in custody at Dane Co Jail at time of missed appearance. 
ADA McGarry makes bond recommendations.  
COURT questions deft re: counsel.  Deft states he does not have means to contact SPD office from jail.  COURT provides number to deft to call.  

COURT ORDERS: $500 cash bond. 
CONDITIONS:  Same conditions as previous bond.  

COURT stays signing of bond until 7 days of release from jail.
